title: @Riot Player telling me to kill myself, not punished at all.
body: So i sent in a support ticket about a player who told me to kill myself several times. They got back to me saying they will be dealt with accordingly. The player is still playing games, no punishment was received at all for telling somebody to kill themselves. So if that is not being punished then please tell me what is punishable because after that i really have no clue how your "justice" system works.

replies.body: lol got perma banned for saying kys i lovrito

There are a few things that could have happened which don't necessarily mean he was ignored;

* He could have received a chat restriction
* They might not have processed his punishment yet
* They may have determined he hasn't done it often enough or the singular case wasn't severe enough to warrant a punishment *yet*.

It's generally not a good idea to ban someone for a single mistake. Some people have bad days, but unless they act like this often a ban isn't going to help anybody; it'd be punishing someone for a single event that wasn't going to happen again anyway. Riot's Player Behavior Initiative is meant to *reform* players, not just punish them.

If you make a mistake just once, do you want to get banned because someone made a ticket?

By far the best way to deal with those kinds of people *in-game* is to ignore them (obviously reporting them *post-game*), that way they aren't getting the response they're looking for. The mute button exists for a reason, after all.
